Animation Demo

You can create something like this but with your own theme

Here's an example of something you might create.

Make The Bubbles Move

You’ll need a function that knows how to move one bubble:

function moveBubble() {

  // code to move a single bubble goes here

}

And you’ll also need to run the function for every bubble:

var allBubbles = $('.bubble');
allBubbles.each( moveBubble );
When the page loads we want the bubbles to move. To move the bubbles, we need a reference to all the bubbles. Once we have all the bubbles, we can run the function on them.

Identifying a Single Bubble

function moveBubble() {

  var bubble = $(this);

}
We said that each bubble should be run with the moveBubble function. When we have a whole set of things and we run a function on each one individually, inside the function we can get the bubble using the keyword "this". Inside the function "this" means "this bubble".

New Bubble Position

function moveBubble() {

var bubble = $(this);

var leftSpace = Math.random() * container.width();
var topSpace = Math.random() * container.height();

}
Inside this function, we need to decide on some new CSS values for our bubble. Once we have new values, we can animate a slow change from the old values to the new values.

New Bubble CSS

function moveBubble() {

var bubble = $(this);

var leftSpace = Math.random() * container.width();
var topSpace = Math.random() * container.height();

var newCSS = {
  'left': leftSpace,
  'top': topSpace
}

bubble.animate( newCSS, 5000 );

}

Your bubbles should now move when you refresh.

Inside this function, we need to decide on some new CSS values for our bubble. Once we have new values, we can animate a slow change from the old values to the new values.

Animating Size

Add a new size to your animation:

var leftSpace = Math.random() * container.width();
var topSpace = Math.random() * container.height();
var size = Math.random() * 200;

var newCSS = {
  'left': leftSpace,
  'top': topSpace,
  'width': size,
  'height': size
}

Your bubbles should now move and change size.

You can also change the size. Create another variable to calculate the new width and height, then add that to the animation set.

Animation time

var animationTime = Math.random() * 10000 + 5000;
bubble.animate( newCSS, animationTime );
At the moment, all our bubbles take 5 seconds to animate from their old CSS values to their new values. We can use a random number generator to have each bubble take a different amount of time to animate.

Floating forever

bubble.animate( newCSS, animationTime, moveBubble );
We can also make our bubbles animate forever. We do this by waiting until the end of the animation, and then running the bubble through `moveBubble` all over again.
